thread.title: Trio robs Bath Township gas station at gunpoint
thread.title_full: Trio robs Bath Township gas station at gunpoint | cleveland.com

author: Adam Ferrise, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Trio robs Bath Township gas station at gunpoint
text:
BATH TOWNSHIP, Ohio â€” Three men robbed a Circle K gas station at gunpoint.
The robbery happened about 11 p.m. Thursday at the gas station in the 700 block of Cleveland-Massillon Road.
The three men walked into the store with their shirts pulled over their faces, Bath Township Police Chief Mike McNeely said.
The gunman pointed the handgun at a 23-year-old employee and demanded money. The group left with about $300, and $340 worth of Black and Mild cigars and Newport cigarettes, according to police reports.
No one was injured in the incident.
The trio ran from the store and drove off in a gold van with a large dent behind the front left wheel, police reports say.
No arrests have been made in the case.
McNeely said officers gathered surveillance video from the gas station and are looking for other videos from nearby businesses. He said they plan to interview witnesses Friday and check to see if the incident is similar to other robberies in the Akron area.
